description: Write tests against the REAL expected API BEFORE implementing code. Tests MUST fail initially. Set up real test data and call real API. Failure reveals complete API design. Example: project = Project(path=path); project.initialize() (doesn't exist yet -> fails -> drives implementation)

do.description: Write test against real expected API that fails initially. Example: project = Project(path); project.initialize(); assert project.is_ready (fails until implemented)

guidance.description: Call the real expected API even if it doesn't exist
example: from mymodule import Project  # Will fail: ImportError

guidance.description: Set up real test data (files, directories)
example: project = Project(config_path=config_path)  # Real file, real path

dont.description: Don't use placeholders, dummy values, or skip the failing step. Example: project = 'TODO' (wrong); assuming test passes first (wrong)

example: config = {}  # WRONG if real config has required fields
# WRONG: Implementing code before test fails
# Test should fail with ImportError/AttributeError first

guidance.description: Don't write tests that pass immediately
example: def test_something(): assert True  # WRONG - proves nothing
